user_question: How many PTO days do full-time employees get per year?
system_answer: Full-time employees accrue 15 days of PTO per year, prorated for partial years. Unused PTO does not roll over into the next calendar year and is forfeited.
chunks_related:
Paid Time Off (PTO) Policy
Full-time employees accrue 15 days of PTO per year, prorated for partial years. PTO begins accruing on the first day of employment and is available for use after 90 days. Unused PTO does not roll over into the next calendar year and is forfeited.

user_question: What is the deadline for new hires to complete onboarding paperwork?
system_answer: New hires must complete all onboarding paperwork within 3 business days of their start date.
chunks_related:
Employee Onboarding Process
New hires must complete all onboarding paperwork within 3 business days of their start date. This includes tax forms, direct deposit setup, and acknowledgment of company policies. Failure to complete onboarding on time may delay payroll processing.

user_question: Can I work remotely every day?
system_answer: No, employees may work remotely up to 3 days per week with manager approval. Remote work requests must be submitted via the HR portal at least 5 business days in advance.
